thread.title: Arsenal’s Alexis Sanchez can expect a rough time against Lincoln City today
thread.title_full: Arsenal’s Alexis Sanchez can expect a rough time against Lincoln City today

author: markbrus88
title: Arsenal’s Alexis Sanchez can expect a rough time against Lincoln City today
text:
LONDON, ENGLAND – MARCH 07: Alexis Sanchez of Arsenal during the UEFA Champions League Round of 16 second leg match between Arsenal FC and FC Bayern Muenchen at Emirates Stadium on March 7, 2017 in London, United Kingdom. (Photo by Catherine Ivill – AMA/Getty Images) Lincoln City defender Bradley Wood has revealed his simple but effective plan to deal with Alexis Sanchez in today’s FA Cup clash with Arsenal .
Chelsea v Man Utd preview: Odds stacked against Mourinho in revenge mission The non-league minnows face a daunting task at the Emirates Stadium this evening, but Wood insists he’s ready to keep Sanchez quiet by any means possible.
While Premier League clubs and top sides around Europe have the players and coaches to make a more sophisticated game plan work, Wood says he’s ready to ‘smash’ Sanchez if necessary.
Bradley Wood helped Lincoln knock out Burnley in the last round (Picture: Getty) The Chilean is one of the best attacking players in Europe on his day, but could be in for a rough time in today’s game.
Arsenal fixtures Lincoln – FA Cup (H) – 11 Mar
West Brom (A) – Sat 18 Mar
Manchester City (H) – Sun 2 Apr
West Ham (H) – Wed 5 Apr
Crystal Palace (A) – Mon 10 Apr
Middlesbrough (A) – Mon 17 apr
Sunderland (H) – Sat 22 Apr
Tottenham (A) – Sun 30 Apr
More: Football PSG's crushing Champions League humiliation could prove bad news for Spurs 
Arsenal step up chase for Sanchez replacement by scouting 32-goal sensation 
Is this really Wenger's LOWEST point? 5 more times the Arsenal boss looked doomed 
‘There are many ways to skin a cat and by hook or crook that’s what I’ll try to do to him. If he tries to run me in the channels then I’m smashing him!’ Wood told the Daily Mail.
‘That’s not to say that I’m going to boot him 24/7 but if I manage to keep him quiet then I’ll have done a good job.’
MORE: Arsenal legend tells club to consider these two potential Wenger replacements
